title: Edit a license record
content:
You can edit multiple records simultaneously by selecting them in the grid and updating them in the Preview pane on the right.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Software Asset > Licenses.

  2. Select the license record you want to edit.

    To filter the record list, click the Add filter  button.

  3. Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected record.

    In the right pane, the Related Contracts widget displays all of the contracts related to the record you are viewing.

    • Click the down arrow to expand the list of related contracts.
    • Click a contract to see its full details.

    The icon in the left of the contract indicates the type of contract:

  4. By default, the license record is displayed with the General tab selected. Click the tab you want to edit or view.

    Tab Description
    General Displays overview and details for the selected record.
    Workflow Displays the workflow metaphase and phase for the selected record.
    Use rights Displays the available use rights applicable to the selected perpetual record.
    License Keys Displays details of any software keys which validates or activates the use of the software.
    Finance Displays information about acquisition and connection to fixed assets, as well as expense lines.
    Discussions Displays any relevant conversations about the selected record.
    History Displays changes to the selected record.

  5. Save your changes.

 

General tab

 

  1. Complete the Overview section.

    Field Description
    Display label External (common) name of the software.
    License class The classification of the license. It is set to Purchased license by default for licenses added from the Software Asset Management module.
    License metric Metric of license.
    Note: If you enable SAM that integrates with CMS, we recommend that you remove the License metric field here by using Studio.
    License model License asset model.
    Publisher Software publisher.
    Owner The person who manages or monitors the software.
    Asset tag Asset tag value for the software.
    Quantity The number of licenses.
    Unit rights

    The number of authorized rights included in one license.

    For example, an organization might buy 5 licenses (the Quantity) each of which allows 20 authorized users (the Unit Rights).
    Total entitlements Total number of rights to install or use the licensed software according to the license.
    Perpetual

    Select if the license is perpetual.

    Note When the license is checked as perpetual, 

    • You need to further check wether it's an upgrade license.
    • The Start date and End date fields no longer apply.
    Upgrade license Select if the license is an upgrade license.
    Note: Available when the license is a perpetual one.
    Suite Select if the software is part of a bundled suite of software. 
    Note: Available when the license is a perpetual one.
    Start date Start date for entitlement to use the software.
    Note: Available when the license is a subscription.
    End date End date for entitlement to use the software.
    Note: Available when the license is a subscription.
    Edition The software edition, if applicable. For example, "Enterprise."
    Version Software version.
    OS type Type of operating system. For example, "Windows" or "UNIX."
    OS name Name of the operating system.
    Language Language of the software.
    Close code

    Select a code from the drop-down list describing why the license is ended.

    Note: Available when the license is in the Ended phase.

    Located at location

    When the license is in the Receive phase and the Located in stockroom field isn't empty, this value is read-only and is automatically populated with the location of the selected Located in stockroom.

  2. Complete the Details section.

    Field Description
    License contract Contract under which the license is provided.
    Quantity The number of licenses.
    Unit rights

    The number of authorized rights included in one license.

    For example, an organization might buy 5 licenses (the Quantity) each of which allows 20 authorized users (the Unit Rights).
    Description Description of the software.

    Located in stockroom

    The stockroom that stores the asset.

    Available when: The license is in the Receive phase.

    Stockroom entry date

    The date the asset entered into stock.

    Available when: The license is in the Receive phase.
    1st level support The group assigned to support the license.
    2nd level support The next level of escalation when an issue isn't resolved by the level 1 group.
    3rd level support The final escalation level when an issue isn't resolved by the level 2 group.

  3. Complete the Maintenance section.

    Field Description
    Default maintenance contract The name of the maintenance contract for the license.
    Maintenance end date The date the maintenance of the license ends. By default this field inherits the value from the default maintenance contract.

  4. Complete the User list section.

    This section displays the end users who can use a license.

    To add a linked record:

    1. Click Add or the grid icon .

    2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow.

    3. Click Save.

    To remove a linked record:

    1. Select the record(s).

    2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.

    3. Click Save.

  5. Attachments

    Click Add attachment if you want to attach a file to the record.

    • The supported attachment file formats and the maximum file size of an attachment are defined in the tenant's Application settings tab in Suite Administration.

    • If the Attachments field has been defined as encrypted for this record type and you are a member of an encryption domain, click Add encrypted attachments to attach an encrypted file to the record.

    • Attachments aren't visible in the Service Portal.

 

License keys tab

 

You can add, edit, or delete license keys.

  • To add a license key:
    1. Click Add. The License key dialog box appears.
    2. Complete the License key field and click Add.
    3. Click Save.
  • To edit a license key:
    1. Select the license key you want to edit.
    2. Click Edit. The License key dialog box appears.
    3. Edit the License key field and click Apply.
    4. Click Save.
  • To delete a license key:
    1. Select the license key you want to edit.
    2. Click Delete.
    3. Click Save.
 

Finance tab

 

The following fields appear on this tab.

Cost

Field Description
Cost type The type of cost. For example, hardware maintenance or software.
Cost center The business unit that the license is charged to.

Acquisition 

Field Description
Acquisition type The type of acquisition. For example, purchase or lease.
Acquisition date Date of the acquisition.
Acquisition end date Date the acquisition ends. For example, the end of the lease.
Total amount Amount paid to acquire the license.
Currency Currency of the amount paid.
Tax rate (%) Applicable tax rate.
Payment terms When payment is contractually due.
Payment date Actual date of payment.

Receiving line

The receiving line related to the license.

Purchase order

The purchase order related to the license.
External PO number The relevant purchase order number.
Invoice number Number of the invoice for the license.

Fixed assets

This section displays summary information about fixed asset records associated with this license asset.

This section applies only when the acquisition type is Purchase, or empty.

  • Click the record identifier in the Id column to display the selected fixed asset record.

  • You can add an association to a fixed asset record or remove one from the record.

    To add a linked record:

    1. Click Add or the grid icon .

    2. Select the record(s). The added items appear in yellow.

    3. Click Save.

    To remove a linked record:

    1. Select the record(s).

    2. Click Remove. The selected items appear in strikethrough text.

    3. Click Save.

 

Expense lines

Displays the expense lines generated or created for the license.

Use rights tab

The Use rights tab page is only available when you flag a record as a perpetual license, allowing you to manage the use rights for that specific record. For detailed use right workflows, see Best practices for license management.

License migration

If the selected record involves license metric changes, input the values for the Migrate to and Total rights after migration fields.

  • The Migrate to field allows users to select a new license model with a different license metric and applies to specific product versions. 
  • The Total rights after migration field defines the number of license points that the selected license consumes after the license migration happens.

Upgrade rights

Check Support upgrades when available based on whether your effective maintenance contract includes the auto-upgrade services or not.

Upgrade license

An upgrade license is a type of software license that grants users the right to upgrade from their current version of the software to a newer version by paying a fee. This is often a more cost-effective option than buying a full license directly.

To upgrade, you can select an applicable upgrade license from the Upgrade to dropdown list.

Upgrade from

This section displays a grid of base licenses of the selected license record when it's an upgrade license.

  • For more information about use rights, see Best practices for license management.
